result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin M Schechter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 2:35pm. 
Defendant Austin M Schechter in court, in custody, with Attorney Stephen J. Eisenberg.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent M. Ellestad is present. 
Judge Hue explains the Jefferson County criminal case-assignment status and the reason why he intends to preside at this Sentencing After Revocation Hearing today.  The Court provides the Defense with the right to substitutoin. 
Attorney Eisenberg indicates that the Defense has no objection to Judge Hue conducting the Sentencing. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Mr. Schechter makes a statement.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Schechter to serve 12 months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges only for purposes of treatement, to commence forthwith. 
Days credit for time already served:  167 days 
Agent Ellestad submits a proposed order for entry of a civil judgment for an amount due of $421.57. The Court adopts this as its Order.
Felony firearms prohibition warnings are given.
recess 3:31pm
from Attorney Van Wagner requesting to be removed as Attorney of Record
Per Judicial Rotation and Case Assignment Plan effective 4/1/17

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:55am [mo]
Defendant Austin M Schechter in court with Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

The Court is presented as part of the sentencing in case 15CF189 a Stipulation for Judgement for Case 15CV266; the Court notes that Judge Weston has jurisdiction of case 15CV266 and will leave to that Court the entry of judgement on case 15CV266.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining counts of Case 15CF189 and the uncharged read-in: DA Case # 2015JE1635 Date of Violation of 7/7/15 Charge of Felony Bail Jumping 946.49(1)(b)

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges; to commence 12/21/15 at 7:00PM
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--drug testing at the discretion of the supervising Agent
--to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand


Days credit for time already served:  1  day

The Court grants Mr. Schechter the eligibility for "special disposition"/ expungement under 973.015
The Court does NOT suspend Mr. Schechter's operating privileges 
recess: 10:40am
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-07-2015 09:45 am
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 9:06am [mo]
Defendant Austin M Schechter in court with Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr.Schechter waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--The Defendant stands mute, the Court enters pleas of "not guilty" on behalf of Mr. Schechter

Atty. Van Wagner updates Mr. Schechter's address to North Main St. in Jefferson, indicates that he still resides with his parents as conditioned in the bond
recess: 9:13am--reconvene:9:14am [for scheduling]
The Clerk announces projected plea/sent date
recess 9:15am
NEXT:  Plea/Sentencing on 12/7/15 at 9:45am

Case called at 1:25 pm [sf]
Defendant Austin M Schechter in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek advises that SPD appears for bond purposes only, a financial evaluation has not been conducted.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Address and DOB information verified.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Take all controlled substances as prescribed
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No contact with Brianna Schliepp
-Defendant must reside with his parents in Hartland (He has to sleep there and get his mail there)

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

**Off record Defendant's mother provides address in Hartland**

Recess: 1:30 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
